verses.verse: Then sang <WH7891> <WH8799> D'vorah <WH1683> and Barak <WH1301> the son <WH1121> of Abinoam <WH42> on that day <WH3117>, saying <WH559> <WH8800>,
Praise <WH1288> <WH8761> ye the YY <WH3068> for the avenging <WH6544> <WH8800> <WH6546> of Yisra'EL <WH3478>, when the people <WH5971> willingly offered <WH5068> <WH8692> themselves.

Hear <WH8085> <WH8798>, O ye kings <WH4428>; give ear <WH238> <WH8685>, O ye princes <WH7336> <WH8802>; I, even I, will sing <WH7891> <WH8799> unto the YY <WH3068>; I will sing <WH2167> <WH8762> praise to the YY <WH3068> 'Elohim <WH430> of Yisra'EL <WH3478>.

YY <WH3068>, when thou wentest out <WH3318> <WH8800> of Seir <WH8165>, when thou marchedst out <WH6805> <WH8800> of the field <WH7704> of Edom <WH123>, the earth <WH776> trembled <WH7493> <WH8804>, and the heavens <WH8064> dropped <WH5197> <WH8804>, the clouds <WH5645> also dropped <WH5197> <WH8804> water <WH4325>.
The mountains <WH2022> melted <WH5140> <WH8804> from before <WH6440> the YY <WH3068>, even that Sinai <WH5514> from before <WH6440> the YY <WH3068> 'Elohim <WH430> of Yisra'EL <WH3478>.

In the days <WH3117> of Shamgar <WH8044> the son <WH1121> of Anath <WH6067>, in the days <WH3117> of Jael <WH3278>, the highways <WH734> were unoccupied <WH2308> <WH8804>, and the travellers <WH1980> <WH8802> walked <WH3212> <WH8799> through byways <WH6128> <WH5410>.

The inhabitants of the villages <WH6520> ceased <WH2308> <WH8804>, they ceased <WH2308> <WH8804> in Yisra'EL <WH3478>, until that I D'vorah <WH1683> arose <WH6965> <WH8804>, that I arose <WH6965> <WH8804> a mother <WH517> in Yisra'EL <WH3478>.

They chose <WH977> <WH8799> new <WH2319> 'elohim <WH430>; then was war <WH3901> in the gates <WH8179>: was there a shield <WH4043> or spear <WH7420> seen <WH7200> <WH8735> among forty <WH705> thousand <WH505> in Yisra'EL <WH3478> ?

My heart <WH3820> is toward the governors <WH2710> <WH8802> of Yisra'EL <WH3478>, that offered themselves willingly <WH5068> <WH8693> among the people <WH5971>. Bless <WH1288> <WH8761> ye the YY <WH3068>.
Speak <WH7878> <WH8798>, ye that ride <WH7392> <WH8802> on white <WH6715> asses <WH860>, ye that sit <WH3427> <WH8802> in judgment <WH4055>, and walk <WH1980> <WH8802> by the way <WH1870>.

They that are delivered from the noise <WH6963> of archers <WH2686> <WH8764> in the places of drawing water <WH4857>, there shall they rehearse <WH8567> <WH8762> the righteous acts <WH6666> of the YY <WH3068>, even the righteous acts <WH6666> toward the inhabitants of his villages <WH6520> in Yisra'EL <WH3478>: then shall the people <WH5971> of the YY <WH3068> go down <WH3381> <WH8804> to the gates <WH8179>.

Awake <WH5782> <WH8798>, awake <WH5782> <WH8798>, D'vorah <WH1683>: awake <WH5782> <WH8798>, awake <WH5782> <WH8798>, utter <WH1696> <WH8761> a song <WH7892>: arise <WH6965> <WH8798>, Barak <WH1301>, and lead thy captivity <WH7628> captive <WH7617> <WH8798>, thou son <WH1121> of Abinoam <WH42>.

Then he made him that remaineth <WH8300> have dominion <WH7287> <WH8762> over the nobles <WH117> among the people <WH5971>: the YY <WH3068> made me have dominion <WH7287> <WH8762> over the mighty <WH1368>.

Out of Efrayim <WH669> was there a root <WH8328> of them against Amalek <WH6002>; after <WH310> thee, Binyamin <WH1144>, among thy people <WH5971>; out of Machir <WH4353> came down <WH3381> <WH8804> governors <WH2710> <WH8781>, and out of Z'vulun <WH2074> they that handle <WH4900> <WH8802> the pen <WH7626> of the writer <WH5608> <WH8802>.

And the princes <WH8269> of Yissakhar <WH3485> were with D'vorah <WH1683>; even Yissakhar <WH3485>, and also Barak <WH1301>: he was sent <WH7971> <WH8795> on foot <WH7272> into the valley <WH6010>. For the divisions <WH6390> of Re'uven <WH7205> there were great <WH1419> thoughts <WH2711> of heart <WH3820>.

Why abodest <WH3427> <WH8804> thou among <WH996> the sheepfolds <WH4942>, to hear <WH8085> <WH8800> the bleatings <WH8292> of the flocks <WH5739>? For the divisions <WH6390> of Re'uven <WH7205> there were great <WH1419> searchings <WH2714> of heart <WH3820>.

Gil`ad <WH1568> abode <WH7931> <WH8804> beyond <WH5676> Yarden <WH3383>: and why did Dan <WH1835> remain <WH1481> <WH8799> in ships <WH591>? Asher <WH836> continued <WH3427> <WH8804> on the sea <WH3220> shore <WH2348>, and abode <WH7931> <WH8799> in his breaches <WH4664>.
Z'vulun <WH2074> and Naftali <WH5321> were a people <WH5971> that jeoparded <WH2778> <WH8765> their lives <WH5315> unto the death <WH4191> <WH8800> in the high places <WH4791> of the field <WH7704>.

The kings <WH4428> came <WH935> <WH8804> and fought <WH3898> <WH8738>, then fought <WH3898> <WH8738> the kings <WH4428> of Kanahan <WH3667> in Taanach <WH8590> by the waters <WH4325> of Megiddo <WH4023>; they took <WH3947> <WH8804> no gain <WH1215> of money <WH3701>.
They fought <WH3898> <WH8738> from heaven <WH8064>; the stars <WH3556> in their courses <WH4546> fought <WH3898> <WH8738> against Sisra <WH5516>.

The river <WH5158> of Kishon <WH7028> swept them away <WH1640> <WH8804>, that ancient <WH6917> river <WH5158>, the river <WH5158> Kishon <WH7028>. O my soul <WH5315>, thou hast trodden down <WH1869> <WH8799> strength <WH5797>.
Then were the horsehoofs <WH6119> <WH5483> broken <WH1986> <WH8804> by the means of the pransings <WH1726>, the pransings <WH1726> of their mighty ones <WH47>.

Curse <WH779> <WH8798> ye Meroz <WH4789>, said <WH559> <WH8804> the angel <WH4397> of the YY <WH3068>, curse <WH779> <WH8798> ye bitterly <WH779> <WH8800> the inhabitants <WH3427> <WH8802> thereof; because they came <WH935> <WH8804> not to the help <WH5833> of the YY <WH3068>, to the help <WH5833> of the YY <WH3068> against the mighty <WH1368>.

Blessed <WH1288> <WH8792> above women <WH802> shall Jael <WH3278> the wife <WH802> of Heber <WH2268> the Kenite <WH7017> be, blessed <WH1288> <WH8792> shall she be above women <WH802> in the tent <WH168>.
He asked <WH7592> <WH8804> water <WH4325>, and she gave <WH5414> <WH8804> him milk <WH2461>; she brought forth <WH7126> <WH8689> butter <WH2529> in a lordly <WH117> dish <WH5602>.

She put <WH7971> <WH8799> her hand <WH3027> to the nail <WH3489>, and her right hand <WH3225> to the workmen's <WH6001> hammer <WH1989>; and with the hammer she smote <WH1986> <WH8804> Sisra <WH5516>, she smote off <WH4277> <WH8804> his head <WH7218>, when she had pierced <WH4272> <WH8804> and stricken through <WH2498> <WH8804> his temples <WH7541>.

At her feet <WH7272> he bowed <WH3766> <WH8804>, he fell <WH5307> <WH8804>, he lay down <WH7901> <WH8804>: at her feet <WH7272> he bowed <WH3766> <WH8804>, he fell <WH5307> <WH8804>: where <WH834> he bowed <WH3766> <WH8804>, there he fell down <WH5307> <WH8804> dead <WH7703> <WH8803>.

The mother <WH517> of Sisra <WH5516> looked <WH8259> <WH8738> out at a window <WH2474>, and cried <WH2980> <WH8762> through the lattice <WH822>, Why is his chariot <WH7393> so long <WH954> <WH8765> in coming <WH935> <WH8800>? why tarry <WH309> <WH8765> the wheels <WH6471> of his chariots <WH4818> ?
Her wise <WH2450> ladies <WH8282> answered <WH6030> <WH8799> her, yea, she returned <WH7725> <WH8686> answer <WH561> to herself,

Have they not sped <WH4672> <WH8799>? have they not divided <WH2505> <WH8762> the prey <WH7998>; to every <WH7218> man <WH1397> a damsel <WH7356> or two <WH7361>; to Sisra <WH5516> a prey <WH7998> of divers colours <WH6648>, a prey <WH7998> of divers colours <WH6648> of needlework <WH7553>, of divers colours <WH6648> of needlework on both sides <WH7553>, meet for the necks <WH6677> of them that take the spoil <WH7998> ?

So let all thine enemies <WH341> <WH8802> perish <WH6> <WH8799>, O YY <WH3068>: but let them that love <WH157> <WH8802> him be as the sun <WH8121> when he goeth forth <WH3318> <WH8800> in his might <WH1369>. And the land <WH776> had rest <WH8252> <WH8799> forty <WH705> years <WH8141>.
